channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Malaysia Airlines denies New Zealand exemption visa holders from boarding
item.description: People with exemption visas to travel to New Zealand have been prevented from boarding a Malaysia Airlines flight from Cambodia after airline staff refused to accept their paperwork.

item.title: DOC defends fisher who caught protected great white shark
item.description: A fisherman has faced a barrage of criticism for causing the death of the protected species, but the Department of Conservation says he did the right thing by reporting it.

item.title: Corrections at fault over inmate's heart attack, hospital stays
item.description: The Department of Corrections failed to give a prisoner regular medication resulting in five hospitalisations, a heart attack and four stents, an inquiry has found.

item.title: Child dies in unknown circumstances in Whanganui
item.description: The child was taken to Whanganui Hospital but was unable to be revived.

item.title: Team NZ and NZME go head-to-head in court over report
item.description: A stoush over whether a report into the financial management of America's Cup should be publicised has been heard in the High Court.

item.title: Public to get say on massive development projects in Drury
item.description: Some Auckland councillors are concerned with how the city is going to pay for the billions of dollars worth of infrastructure that will be needed to support it.

item.title: Residents at Stamford Plaza Hotel seek isolation safety reassurance
item.description: Concerns are being raised that dividers installed at Auckland's Stamford Plaza Hotel are not enough to keep residents separated from people in managed isolation.

item.title: Stuff closure of social media accounts about trust, editor says
item.description: News website Stuff is suspending all of its activity on Facebook and Instagram until further notice.

item.title: Mataura ouvea premix toxic waste problem goes to court
item.description: The Environmental Defence Society has filed court proceedings over 10,000 tonnes of potentially toxic waste dumped in Mataura.

item.title: Warbirds over Wanaka crash caused by 'systemic failures' - lawyer
item.description: Recordings of the moment a vintage plane crashed at Warbirds over Wanaka have been played in court as the pilot tries to recover costs.

item.title: Wiri youth justice facility escape 'out of the blue'
item.description: A removed window is at the centre of an investigation into how Haami Hanara and another teen escaped from a youth justice facility in Auckland.

item.title: Rocket Lab will be 'working hard' to find answers on failed mission
item.description: Rocket Lab won't be launching another mission until they know what caused the rocket to fail yesterday.

item.title: War memorial Carillon bell tower safety plans in place - government
item.description: Plans are in place for public safety at the earthquake-prone National War Memorial Carillon bell tower in Wellington, the government says.

item.title: Rules to reduce choking risk delayed due to Covid-19
item.description: The introduction of hard-and-fast rules to cut the risk of toddlers choking on food at childcare centres has been delayed.

item.title: Covid-19 update: One new case in managed isolation
item.description: The new case is a man is his 20s who arrived in New Zealand from London.

item.title: Heritage NZ considers listing Wellington Central Library
item.description: Wellington Central Library, still closed after being deemed earthquake prone, could receive a special heritage status.

item.title: Kiwi nurse has cuppa with Boris Johnson
item.description: The New Zealand nurse among those credited with saving Boris Johnson's life has met the UK Prime Minister for a cup of tea.

item.title: Covid-19 quarantine hotels: 'We need military-like precision'
item.description: An epidemiologist wants those returning to this country to be confined to their rooms during Covid-19 quarantine.
